programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man tries to sell a series of poorly stuffed animals, leading to to an unusual threat being made against Les.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: In the signature dish round, the chefs showcase their heritage and bring the heat.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Documentary following two brothers searching for the mysterious treasure buried on a Nova Scotia island, which is believed to be protected by a deadly curse.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A team risks life and limb by crossing the Mississippi's shipping lanes in search of gators.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie and his team deal with a jack-knifed semi-trailer on the edge of a bridge and the Mission Towing team races to reopen an active logging road.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine a torch from the 1984 Olympics, the world's smallest pistol and a 1937 car that may once have belonged to gangster Bugsy Siegel.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick risks buying a painting supposedly by Renaissance artist Albrecht Durer, but then has to ascertain if it is genuine. He also judges the value of a motorcycle.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman sells an artistic statue of an old woman in a bathing suit, but when Les buys it, Seth blames Ashley for contributing to the purchase.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The store is divided as Ashley and Seth lay claim to their own individual turfs, while a fake ID puts Les in an awkward situation. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: Armed with a budget of £1,000, the teams scour the scrapyards in search of fast cars such as Ferraris and Porsches. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: As Rick and Marty continue to explore the abandoned shaft known as '10-X', they uncover evidence that may jeopardise their whole operation..

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: A Haunted Antique Store and More
programme.desc: The stories of a UFO spotted over Inner Mongolia, a poltergeist haunting a British antique shop and a father and son who claimed to have encountered Bigfoot in Washington.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate remote ruins, mysterious caves and legendary mountain portals, asking if these alleged stargates have brought ancient aliens to Earth.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare copy of Seven Years in Tibet signed by author Heinrich Harrer turns up at the shop, and Corey teams up with Chumlee to check out a Three Stooges promotional projector.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A collection of original 1960s NBC posters arrive at the shop, and the team is asked to appraise a 1966 Harley Davidson.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Fat Lady Is Warming Up
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi look to coast through the auctions, but end up having a marathon. Darrell faces the auction without Brandon to back him up.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hit the Palm Springs desert hoping for some hot profits. Mary sticks to a tight budget while Darrell is willing to spend big.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: In the signature dish round, the chefs showcase their heritage and bring the heat.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Seth continue continue their tense stand-off, but a demanding customer forces them to band together. A signed and authenticated Elvis record stimulates interest, but Les and Rich are wary of paying too much for it.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Matters come to a head when Rich invades Ashley's territory in the jewellery and loan department.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: Armed with a budget of £1,000, the teams scour the scrapyards in search of fast cars such as Ferraris and Porsches. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The 1961 Betty and Barney Hill alien abduction case in Lincoln, New Hampshire. Plus, the surgical removal of a supposed alien implant from a man's leg.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigating the theory that aliens could have inhabited underwater cities on Earth, and exploring the legendary ruins in Peru, as well as some revealing Indian texts.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: As Rick and Marty continue to explore the abandoned shaft known as '10-X', they uncover evidence that may jeopardise their whole operation..

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Cindy buys a shirt for Rick that is not to his taste, while Bogart puts his dad on an extremely healthy diet - much to his displeasure.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Bogart plans to buy a house, and encourages Paul to make a big sale so he can raise a deposit. Meanwhile, Ursula's coat attracts a lot of attention.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: Three chefs get fired up as they compete for charities near and dear to their hearts.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Tornadoes tear through Texas, rip tides trap swimmers in Florida, a storm hits holiday makers in Greece and a wave crashes through a restaurant in Italy.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at what happened when an Ethiopian Airlines flight ran out of fuel and plunged 31,000 feet, and how the pilot attempted to save everyone onboard.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Huntington Beach for a night-time auction. Mary and Ivy get into a heated bidding war, while Dave looks to score big or go home.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene brings his dad to the auction, leading to comical developments, while Ivy goes in big despite carrying an injury.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman sells an artistic statue of an old woman in a bathing suit, but when Les buys it, Seth blames Ashley for contributing to the purchase.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The store is divided as Ashley and Seth lay claim to their own individual turfs, while a fake ID puts Les in an awkward situation. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with Radio 4's The News Quiz host Miles Jupp and journalist Quentin Letts joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and musician Bill Bailey, actress Una Stubbs and radio presenter Alice Levine to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include taramasalata, people who talk too loudly and drama cliches.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Panellists Sarah Millican, Eddie Kadi, Noel Fielding and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry mucks about with a messy mixture of M-themed matters. As usual, the host poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: An illusionist performs his 'the lady vanishes' act rather too well and wonders if he has genuine magic powers. Mackenzie Crook spins this twisted yarn.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle take downhill mountain-bike racing to the next level by adding more wheels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Victoria and Albert's Highland Fling
programme.desc: Tony Robinson visits the Cairngorms National Park to discover how Queen Victoria and Prince Albert helped shape Scottish traditions and imagery, such as tartan, bagpipes and caber-tossing. Starting in Pitlochry, he traverses the Killiecrankie Pass, where the Jacobites won the Battle of Killiecrankie, and ends his trek at Balmoral and the fantasy castle Albert built as his and Victoria's Highland escape.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day explores the case of Edith Thompson, who conspired with her lover to murder her husband in 1922 - a story that inspired Alfred Hitchcock.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second visit in this series to Plas Newydd on the Isle of Anglesey. The team examine rarities including a cabinet with a secret function, a magazine rack made by celebrated designer Piero Fornasetti, a collection of historical items related to deafness, a Chinese silver punchbowl and a photo that has a connection to the Apollo 11 mission.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the Queen's private residence at Balmoral, Aberdeenshire, where items brought in to be valued include a ceramic pot made by Pablo Picasso, a giant telescope and a diamond tiara. Plus, military specialist Mark Smith challenges Fiona to spot the fake among a collection of rare medals.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: How the Mafia became an unlikely ally of the US in bringing about the downfall of Mussolini, and their subsequent rise in power when the war ended.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: Mars is one of the best-explored places in the solar system and yet we still don't know the answer to the big question - is there or was there life on Mars?.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1970s Bond Bug three-wheeler divides opinion among Mathewsons customers, while a retired engineer reluctantly auctions off his late father's treasured 60s Jaguar Mark 2.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is asked to help the police investigate the case of two brothers found dead in a police cell - but subsequent developments force her to confront the unpalatable truth about her involvement in a murder inquiry 13 years previously.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zain Nadir finds a witness to the Garrison shooting, but inept interference from DI Markham scuppers the case and puts Dale Smith in grave danger as he searches for the gun at Larson's home. Amber Johannsen rumbles Dan's affair with drug referral officer Rochelle Barratt and is warned in no uncertain terms to keep her mouth shut.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A car crash leads to an unusual rescue for the squad. Meanwhile, Nick gets a surprise when he returns home. Starring Andrew Kazamia.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Brad Connor is devastated to learn he may be HIV positive, and makes a drunken pass at Marsha Stubbs. Joy Wilton discovers the joys of mixing work with pleasure.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jeremy is forced to face his fear of heights head-on, and Army widow Joy Wilton gets a second chance at happiness, while Michael and Marsha's marriage shows further signs of crumbling. Starring Ben Nealon, Rob Spendlove, Denise Welch and Meera Syal.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zain Nadir finds a witness to the Garrison shooting, but inept interference from DI Markham scuppers the case and puts Dale Smith in grave danger as he searches for the gun at Larson's home. Amber Johannsen rumbles Dan's affair with drug referral officer Rochelle Barratt and is warned in no uncertain terms to keep her mouth shut.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tricia is rushed back to the hospital after the crash, but Mark's return is delayed when he fails a breath test and finds himself accused of drink-driving. Once out of the police station, he returns to Holby - where horrifying news awaits him. Sam turns detective to discover the truth about Jade's medical background, and Lola almost catches Matt and Nikki in a passionate clinch.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A drug user's angry mother refuses to be pacified and directs her fury at Max. Charlie embarks on a course of action in a bid to win back his son, and Holly receives flowers from a secret admirer. Meanwhile, the paramedics rush to a remote cottage where a boy has been knocked unconscious. Medical drama, starring Robert Gwilym and Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dale Smith ignores a warning from lover Louise to save his own skin and foolishly continues searching Larson's home for the gun used in the Garrison shooting. When he fails to show up at Sun Hill, Nadir is forced to tell Jack Meadows what has been going on. Roger Valentine makes fun of Tony Stamp's hearing problem, but a routine check-up at the hospital proves anything but funny.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil receives some devastating news from Kathy. Frank faces up to an unpleasant reality. Shelley gets caught up in a Fowler feud, and Mark discovers he has a fairy godmother.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard decides to seek out his secret admirer, while Cindy is confused by Ian's behaviour.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are called to rescue a familiar face, and a collapsing building traps an elderly woman. Starring Andrew Kazamia and Glen Murphy.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack struggles to save an asthmatic schoolgirl's life when her mother will only resort to faith healing. Meanwhile, Will has survived his breakdown and is eager to go back to work, determined he and Sarah will resolve their problems. Drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Stubborn postmistress Evie does her best to make Kim feel unwelcome, but a secret from her past soon explains the shopkeeper's icy attitude. Billy is shocked when he gets the job at the factory, David and Megan come to terms with their news, and Nathan lands himself in trouble. Drama, guest starring Elaine Paige.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon tries to make the best of her job at the bakery and Dorien joins the Open University, while Tracey continues to study at the school of hard knocks. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey moves out of Grantleigh Manor, and Richard and his mother move in, disappointing the former resident with their new ways. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour comes up with another madcap scheme to harness the power of nature using an old sail, a pair of roller skates and, in Compo, a very gullible 'test pilot'. Michael Aldridge, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: When You Take a Good Bite, Yorkshire Tastes Terrible
programme.desc: When Clegg receives news of an old friend dying in America, Compo and Seymour join him on a journey down memory lane, recalling time spent at school walking on gates and climbing trees - forgetting, of course, that it was many years ago. Poignant instalament of the long-running comedy, featuring the final appearance of Joe Gladwin as Wally Batty.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate mysterious goings-on when a woman dies after being picked from the audience to assist a magician in a stage trick.

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: A local journalist tries to convince the people of Lighthaven there is a big cat on the moors, but nobody will believe him - until the discovery of his mauled body.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The discovery of a Roman sword with traces of blood on it is linked to an unidentified, headless corpse found near Heathrow in March 2008. It leads the team members to a lock-up belonging to a bodybuilder called Mark Rix, who died of a suspected heart attack the same year, so they start looking for connections between the original murder and Rix's death. They are helped in their investigation by anthropologist Fiona Kennedy, for whom Dan begins to develop feelings - just as he is told his wife might be discharged from the secure hospital where she has spent the past several years. Tracy-Ann Obermann and Liz White guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Sam is not convinced a sports agent committed suicide, after a post-mortem reveals she was in the early stages of pregnancy and bruising to her arms suggests a sexual assault. Matters are complicated further when a client she was planning a new life with is found dead in her flat and tests reveal the father of her baby is Caucasian, putting her husband back in the frame, despite his alibi.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Car Crime: Is My Car Safe? Tonight
programme.desc: Government figures reveal car crime has risen for the past six years. It has even continued in lockdown in some areas. As more motorists are targeted by organised gangs, Alex Beresford investigates what people can do to steer clear of vehicle crime.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Mark is in court to claim for dog training and kennel fees, but defendant Ian says he can no longer afford the payments, while Marko claims £4,500 owed for a car.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis. Five friends from Surrey team up to answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Michael, Rebecca, Chris and Asham pit their wits against ruthless Chaser Shaun Wallace in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie panics when Tracy reveals that Andrea left without her purse, cards, money or car. Kerry is pained as she overhears an emotional Amelia confessing to God that she egged Brenda's windows.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Geoff is forced to come clean about hiring escorts, Asha finds a renewed confidence and Shona agrees to live with Roy rather than David.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.sub-title: Tonight I'll Be Staying Here with You
programme.desc: The lifts in Auntie Vera's block of flats are playing up, which is no good with her hips, so she announces to Sharon and Tracey that she is moving in with them. There's just one little snag - the only available room is Dorien's - and she is somewhat dismayed to be told that family comes first. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph, with a guest appearance from Kate Williams (Love Thy Neighbour).

credits.actor: a guest appearance from Kate Williams (Love Thy Neighbour)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the death of a pensioner found stabbed on a train at the height of rush hour. The case has a huge impact on Joe's home life when his daughter is named as a key witness, and he struggles to maintain a professional distance. The trail leads the team to a quiet Northumberland coastal town where clues appear to lead to one particular street - but why are the residents so reluctant to talk? Starring Brenda Blethyn, with David Leon, Sonya Cassidy, Jon Morrison and Eva Birthistle.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Play to the Whistle
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby welcomes West Ham United footballer Michail Antonio, tennis coach Judy Murray and comedian Joel Dommett to the show. They join team captains Frank Lampard and Bradley Walsh as well as comics Romesh Ranganathan and Seann Walsh.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Jensen Interceptor, but his £5,000 budget restricts him to poor examples of the car, leaving mechanic Edd China with plenty of work to do.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk expert Frank Fritz falls hard for a Harley Davidson 'knucklehead' at a collector's hidden California compound.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The second of four FANtasy bike winners is revealed as the guys head to Texas. The OCC crew spends some time with Susan Morisset to learn how best to customise her chopper. The winner heads out to OCC and gets a tour of the facility and a shopping spree at the retail store. Once receiving her bike, she and Sr go for a truly memorable ride.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: Chronicling 100 years of American aircraft achievements, from the early visionaries to the technological advancements of the modern bomber fleet.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on a succession of unpleasant tasks, this time exploring the depths of Pit 91 before travelling north to find out how much of an animal can be recycled.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew visits the birthplace of the BMW M6 and explores its exterior.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew goes to its birthplace, revealing the inner workings and stunning exterior of the Rolls-Royce Dawn, regarded by many as a dream car.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they take a car from Siberia to the Sahara without leaving Germany? Plus, how do they hand craft a baseball glove that will last a lifetime?.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: In the New Forest, Hampshire, Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove visit a collector of Americana. What rare bicycles and classic sportsters will they find in his sheds?.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace-mechanic Sam Lovegrove are in Buckinghamshire, visiting a trucker with a collection of Harley Davidson bikes and an amazing set of stationary engines.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The captains battle the polar ice pack in a losing bid to save their pots, and the Northwestern and Wizard struggle to escape St Paul harbour.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New team the Bushmen clash with opal thieves raiding one of their mines. The Cookes hack an old digging machine, while the Fire Crew hunt for a new deposit of rare black opal.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Grimsby, the team members have their work cut out when demolishing a pigeon-infested shopping centre. Later, in Norfolk, a sculptor takes scrap metal from a farm.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an old Range Rover Mk3 for a bargain price, hoping Edd China can renovate it and have it resprayed white in order to pass it on for double the amount he paid.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini is asked to sell a collection of Boyd Coddington cars.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini has a 1931 Cadillac ready for auction, and is asked to restore the brakes on a re-creation of a 1937 Bugatti Atlantique.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: An insight into the design specifications of the Porsche 911.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New team the Bushmen clash with opal thieves raiding one of their mines. The Cookes hack an old digging machine, while the Fire Crew hunt for a new deposit of rare black opal.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Northwestern deckhand Jake Anderson is angered by a crew complaint, while on the Ramblin' Rose Elliott Neese faces the ice pack head-on and makes a troubling call home.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Ploughing through a 40-acre salvage yard, junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz harvest a few lost treasures, including a never-before-seen farmer's mini-bike.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Preston, a garage is demolished in the freezing weather. Then in Lincolnshire, a shipping vessel could be massive profit for the team pulling her apart.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Jensen Interceptor, but his £5,000 budget restricts him to poor examples of the car, leaving mechanic Edd China with plenty of work to do.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Bushmen Rod and Les risk their lives re-opening a long-abandoned mine. New team the Young Guns goes deep underground for the first time, hunting pineapple opal.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard tries to meet the expectations of a customer with a taste for mid-century chic in Tyne and Wear, and a rare mirror catches his eye at a former friary.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: When astronomers discover a rogue black hole speeding through the Milky Way, they investigate how much danger it poses to Earth.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Expert miners come to the aid of south-east Asian islanders hoping to extract gold from vast reserves found deep in the heart of crocodile territory.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The casting of bells for cathedrals, and how the environment is cleaned up after large, natural storms.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of tyres made by the Titan Corporation, espresso coffee and how diamonds are cut.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to buy a Ford Sierra Cosworth on a budget of only £5,000, before handing it over to mechanic Edd China for extensive renovation work.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The role of DNA and ballistics reports in helping to solve the murder of a Swedish man whose body was found in a wood.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A 2009 case in which 27-year-old Jessika Kalaher was found strangled in her car in Texas. With her wallet and car keys missing, detectives turned to security cameras for clues.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The fatal shooting of Terri Ann McCoy on her family home's landing, by a lookout guarding fellow robbers who had invaded the building to steal jewellery in November 2009.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: When a Boston police officer is killed by a most-wanted man after investigating a domestic dispute, the Bureau leaves no stone unturned in the search for the culprit.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal cruelty investigators raid a property that they suspect is being used to stage illegal dog fights.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: An unusual patient turns up in the form of an albino echidna, and Chris is invited to Symbio Wildlife Park to carry out a highly dangerous procedure on a female Sumatran tiger.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Two brides leave their maids to choose their own dresses, but Lori has to take control to make sure they do not go down the aisle looking too unusual.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lavina has walked down the aisle 15 times as a bridesmaid, and now it is finally her turn to be the bride, while staff member Jennifer makes a series of rookie mistakes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
programme.desc: Lacey wants a dress that will show off her very large back tattoo, but her mother wants it fully covered.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits with an eye for a bargain scour a market in Rouen in Normandy for treasures to upcycle and sell in north London. Jo revamps an ornate bedframe, Jay turns a soda syphon into a ceiling light and Karing reupholsters some old chairs in modern grey leather. Whoever makes the most money walks away with everyone's cash.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Kristin's gem skills are put to the test when she's faced with a piece of jade that could be worth more than £300,000. A glamorous 47-year-old hopes to pawn her mother's diamond ring to raise funds to stop her father's house from subsiding, and a young couple want to sell a limited-edition Philip Treacy handbag ahead of their wedding. Weybridge manager Jamo takes on his first car assignment, the sale of a 1930s classic, under the watchful eye of Prestige boss and motoring expert James.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: An investigation into America's puppy mills - large-scale commercial breeding kennels that frequently offer a low standard of care.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A man is suspected of violence toward three cats, and a dog whose vision was being restricted by its matted fur receives help.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigating the growing crime of letter-bombing in the USA, and exploring the techniques forensic lab technicians use to trace the perpetrators.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A look at how a flight data recorder or 'black box' is often the only means of telling how an aeroplane crashed. However, the device sometimes generates more questions than answers.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Seattle-based punk rocker Brian Barton, guitarist with As Fate Would Have It. The 25-year-old vanished in March 2005, after a bout of depression during which he left the band, broke up with his fiancee and cut ties with his closest friends.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Roxanne Paltauf, who vanished from a motel in Austin Texas in July 2006 after an argument with her boyfriend. After searching 10 acres for the 18-year-old's remains, police came up empty-handed.

programme.title: True Crime with Aphrodite Jones
programme.desc: The author explores a case in which two children, aged nine and two, were killed by a house fire set deliberately by their mother, Billi Jo Smallwood. Her intention was to escape her unhappy marriage and collect on her soldier husband's life insurance policy.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Kara wants a red dress for her big day, but her future mother-in-law has more traditional ideas. Meanwhile, Sheena needs a gown for her Indian wedding reception.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Dina searches for a dress that is as sassy as she is. Meanwhile, Laure wants a simple lace gown for her big day, but the people around her have different ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Precious looks for a gown to suit her new body following weight-loss surgery, while Stefanie wants a simple dress, but her family has other ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Not What I Had in Mind
programme.desc: Broadway dancer LaQuet is looking for a fun dress with straps to cover her arms as she walks down the aisle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Emily, a lawyer by day and rock singer by night, wants to contrast her normal all-black style with a traditional lace wedding gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The death of the fiance's mother makes bride-to-be Amanda's dress fitting tough, as the consultant also knew the deceased and they had all planned to be present at the ceremony.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: Am I Who I Think I Am?
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner report on Joanna, who discovered her mother kept a life-long secret about the man who raised her, realising her biological father did not know of her.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Lifelong secret eater Nikki finds her life threatened by immobility as her weight climbs to 650lbs. She undergoes gastric bypass and confronts the emotional causes for her eating.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: Pilot Iain Lawrence put his wife Sally on a pedestal. After he lost his job however, her position as a successful businesswoman was a constant reminder of the failure he perceived he had become. When their marriage fell apart, he refused to accept the loss of his wife - or of her wealth and status - and made plans to murder her.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: A case in which a delighted Linda Scarpa learned her biological father Greg was a family friend. However, as his dark secrets emerged, being part of his family proved deadly.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: In 1979, two young boys came home from school to find their mother's dead body in the living room. Investigators set out to track down the killer with no firm leads.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police use trace evidence and paint analysis to track down a killer preying on male prostitutes. Saliva and ink found at the scene of a murder help link a husband to his estranged wife's death.
